answers.answer: Hello,The normal ranges for AST and ALT are around 0 to 40 IU/L and 0 to 45 IU/L respectively.Elevated liver enzymes are found in hepatitis,fatty liver,alcoholic liver disease,obesity,diabetes(uncontrolled),mononucleosis,autoimmune hepatitis,metabolic liver disease,gallstones,tumors of liver,pancreas and bile ducts and side effects of medicines like certain nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), cholesterol medications, antibiotics or anti-seizure medications.I feel that you should consult a physician soon and get these possibilities ruled out.Hope it helps.If you have any additional queries,then pls post us.Take care and regards.

question: I am 21 year old male. I went to my doctor and had a blood test done. I found out i had a slightly elevated liver. I went back for more for blood work a month later and my elevated liver was a little higher than before. I tested negative for Hepatitist. I had an ultra sound done which showed that i do not have gallstones. My doctor said i need to come back in a few weeks for more blood work. He  that i may have to go to a stomach specialist. I have not been experiencing any abnormal stomach pain. I do not know what this could be.
title: elevated liver enzymes
